Global.name: ROOT_COLUMN_NAME
Global.Comment: The column name of the entity id. The name and the order of the root column name must be aligned with root_table_name. For example- if you populate two tables in root_Table_name (separated by a comma), you must populate also two values in this global where the first column referes to the first table name the second column refers to the second table name

Global.name: ROOT_TABLE_NAME
Global.Comment: The name of the main source LU table or tables. You can populate several tables separated by a comma.

Global.name: COMBO_MAX_COUNT
Global.Comment: Maximum values of combo box input object

Global.name: GET_RESERVED_ENTITIES_LIMIT
Global.Comment: The max number of retrieved entities from TDM_RESERVED_ENTITIES, if set to zero then no limit

Global.name: MAX_NUMBER_OF_ENTITIES_IN_LIST
Global.Comment: The maximum number of entities to be returned to be displayed in list of entities

Global.name: SEQ_CACHE_INTERFACE
Global.Comment: Starting from Fabric V7.2, SQLite and PostgreSQL are also supported as Fabric operational DBs in addition to Cassandra. If you use the TDM PG DB as the operational (system) DB, update this Global accordingly and set it to TDM.

Global.name: SEQ_DO_TRUNCATE
Global.Comment: Indication whether to truncate the Masking Keyspace when deploying TDM LU

Global.name: SEQ_DROP_KEYSPACE
Global.Comment: Indication whether to drop existing Masking Keyspace when deploying TDM LU

Global.name: TDM_BATCH_LIMIT
Global.Comment: Limit the number of entities to be populated into the TDM execution tables for a task execution. By default, the number of entities for a task execution is unlimited (-1)

Global.name: TDM_DATAFLUX_TASK
Global.Comment: Indicator to mark the task as dataflux or not

Global.name: TDM_DELETE_BEFORE_LOAD
Global.Comment: Indicator to delete the instance to target DB

Global.name: TDM_EXTERNAL_ENTITY_LIST_TTL
Global.Comment: The TTL for external entity list for non jdbc source DB

Global.name: TDM_INSERT_TO_TARGET
Global.Comment: Indicator to insert the instance to target DB

Global.name: TDM_LU_RETENTION_PERIOD_TYPE
Global.Comment: Each Instance can have a TTL, this global holds the type of the TTL and it can have one of the following values:Minutes, Hours, Days, Weeks, or Years

Global.name: TDM_LU_RETENTION_PERIOD_VALUE
Global.Comment: The value of the TTL based on the type defined in TDM_LU_RETENTION_PERIOD_TYPE. Populate this global with zero or empty value to avoid setting a TTL on the TDM LUIs.

Global.name: TDM_PARAMETERS_SEPARATOR
Global.Comment: The separator to be used for parsing the values of Parameters

Global.name: TDM_POPULATE_JMX_STATS
Global.Comment: Set this Global to true to enable the execution of populationJMX populatio n flow on TASK_EXECUTION TDM LU table.

Global.name: TDM_SEQ_REPORT
Global.Comment: When set to true (the default value), the task execution populates the TDM_SEQ_MAPPING ta ble and generates the Replace Sequence Summary Report tab in the task execution report. This Global can be set to false to avoid the population of TDM_SEQ_MAPPING and the generation of the Replace Sequence Summary Report for a better performance.

Global.name: TDM_SOURCE_PRODUCT_VERSION
Global.Comment: Source product version to override by task execution process

Global.name: TDM_TARGET_PRODUCT_VERSION
Global.Comment: Target product version to override by task execution process

Global.name: ROOT_COLUMN_NAME
Global.Comment: The column name of the entity id. The name and the order of the root column name must be aligned with root_table_name. For example- if you populate two tables in root_Table_name (separated by a comma), you must populate also two values in this global where the first column referes to the first table name the second column refers to the second table name
